action.action-desc: Ms. Velázquez (for herself, Mrs. Cherfilus-McCormick, Ms. Sánchez, Mrs. McIver, Ms. Strickland, Mr. Meeks, Ms. Norton, Mr. Espaillat, Mr. Johnson of Georgia, Ms. Kamlager-Dove, Ms. Crockett, and Ms. Sewell) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Labor to award grants to States for the purpose of providing subgrants to eligible entities for education and technical training on how to perform cosmetology services on textured hair.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Texture Positive Act of 2025.

section.header: Grants for education and technical training on textured hair

subsection.text: The Secretary shall award, on a competitive basis, grants to States for the purpose of awarding subgrants in accordance with this section.

A State seeking a grant under this section shall submit an application to the Secretary at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the Secretary may reasonably require, including a summary of the information submitted under subsection (c)(2) by each eligible entity that the State plans to award a subgrant to under such subsection.

paragraph.text: A State that receives a grant under this section shall use such grant to award, on a competitive basis, subgrants to eligible entities for the purpose of carrying out the activities described in paragraph (3).

An eligible entity seeking a subgrant under this subsection shall submit an application to the State at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the State may reasonably require, including—

subparagraph.text: a description of how the eligible entity plans to carry out the activities described in paragraph (3);

clause.text: the cost of conducting the activities described in paragraph (3), including the cost per student of providing the education and technical training required under subparagraph (A) of such paragraph; and
the number of students the eligible entity plans to instruct; and

subparagraph.text: a description of how the eligible entity plans to increase access to the education and technical training required under paragraph (3)(A).

paragraph.text: An eligible entity that receives a subgrant under this subsection—

subparagraph.text: shall use such subgrant funds to provide, as part of the curriculum of cosmetology schools, education and technical training to students of such cosmetology schools on how to shampoo, deep condition, braid, twist, and style textured hair; and
may use such subgrant funds to, in order to better provide such education and technical training—

clause.text: develop such education and technical training;
provide digital training, including through prerecorded videos.

paragraph.text: A State shall award a subgrant under this subsection in an amount that the State determines appropriate based on the estimate submitted under paragraph (2)(B).
A grant awarded under this section shall be for a term of 4 years and may be renewed by the Secretary.

A subgrant awarded under subsection (c) shall be for a term of 6 months and may be renewed by the State that awarded the subgrant. In determining whether to renew such subgrant, the State shall take into consideration the information submitted under subsection (e).

Not later than 60 days before each date that is the final date of the term described in subsection (d)(2), a recipient of a subgrant under subsection (c) shall submit to the State that awarded the subgrant a report including—

subparagraph.text: a description of how the subgrant was used;
an identification of the cosmetology schools that the eligible entity worked with to provide the education and technical training required under subsection (c)(3)(A);
the number of instructors that the eligible entity trained to provide the education and technical training required under subsection (c)(3)(A); and
the number of students that received the education and technical training required under subsection (c)(3)(A).

paragraph.text: Not later than 60 days after each date that is the final date of the term described in subsection (d)(1), a State that receives a grant under this section shall submit to the Secretary a report including—

subparagraph.text: an identification of the State agency that awards subgrants under this section; and
a summary of the information submitted under paragraph (1).

paragraph.text: The term cosmetology school means a school that provides training to prepare students for gainful employment in an occupation related to cosmetology.

subparagraph.text: means a corporation, limited liability company, association, or company that—

clause.text: was established not less than 5 years before the date of enactment of this Act;
has experience in providing the education and technical training required under subsection (c)(3)(A);
has an employer identification number issued by the Internal Revenue Service; and
has a Minority- or Women-owned Business Enterprise certificate; and
a consortium of cosmetology schools, including an association of such schools;
a cosmetology school that has received, at any point, Federal funds other than through a subgrant under subsection (c).

paragraph.text: The term Secretary means the Secretary of Labor.
The term State means each of the several States, the District of Columbia, and any commonwealth, territory, or possession of the United States.
The term textured hair means hair that is coiled, curly, or wavy in its natural state.
